channel.title: career on Anthony Dellavecchia
channel.description: Recent content in career on Anthony Dellavecchia

item.title: 2022 Personal Recap
item.description: TLDR: 2022 had it’s ups and downs. Here are my accomplishments and reflections on 2022: Stats 741 GitHub contributions 15 NPM packages 48,272 blog views and 150 followers on Medium 16,120 page views and 500 subscribers on Dev.to 2,113 blog views on Twilio.com/blog with 2.78% conversion rate 724 page views on Hashnode 138 members joined my meetup 2,000 unique visitors to my website with an average engagement time of 1 minute 11,000 page views on my website Highlights Left a job with a toxic work environment 🤮 Found my dream job at a tech company 😃 Went from making $100k to $250k+ 🤑 Moved to Seattle ⛰️ Travelled to 7 cities (8 times) for work ✈️ Completed my Masters degree from UCLA 🐻 Started a local meetup group for developers 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Spoke at 7 in-person events 🗣️ Taught at an Ivy League university 🎓 Mentored dozens of early career professionals 🧑‍🏫 Spoke on the Stackoverflow podcast 🎤 Built a video game extension 🕹️ Published 5 articles on Twilio’s blog ✍️ Wrote 10 personal blog posts 📝 Build an app that was featured on a developer keynote 🎬 Collaborated with 1Password about their CLI 🔒 Started a Twitch coding channel 📹 I am so grateful for all of the opportunities that came my way in 2022.

item.title: AI Wrote this Blog Post About Taking Over Your Job
item.description: TLDR: This blog post was automatically generated using ChatGPT from OpenAI and the prompt “Write a viral blog post explaining why software engineers should and shouldn’t be worried about AI taking over their jobs”. The image used in this post was also created by AI from DALL-E 2 with the prompt “A dystopian painting of an evil robot with a mean face destroying the world from space”. It was inspirted from this blog post by Brendan O’Leary

item.title: Introducing Developer Evangelist Anthony Dellavecchia
item.description: I got a job at Twilio! I joined Twilio, an awesome tech company headquarted in the Bay. This is my first time breaking into tech and I’m so grateful. I’m joining as a Staff level Developer Evangelist. Check out my official intro on Twilio’s blog What is a Developer Evangelist? Well, the answer varies based on who you ask but my main goal is to inspire and empower software developers around the world.
